tool_manager¶

Functions¶

def deregisterToolType()

def install()

def installer()

def isInstalled()

def iterInstalled()

def iterToolTypes()

def uninstall()

def uninstallFromAll()

def uninstaller()

Description¶

Install and uninstall tools through a common interface.

Terminology¶

The following terminology is adopted by this module.

Term Description
Tool type An identifier for a specific type of tool, consisting of a namespace and a name.
Installer: A callable which has been registered to a tool type via the installer() decorator factory. The callable is responsible for creating tools associated with the specified tool type.
Uninstaller: A callable which has been registered to a tool type via the uninstaller() decorator factory. The callable is responsible for removing tools associated with the specified tool type.

Decoration¶

Once a pair of installer and uninstaller callables have been decorated, the associated tool type is considered registered to this interface. A registered tool type can be used to install, uninstall and retrieve tools via this interface.

Example:
@installer("MyToolNamespace", "MyToolName")
def installMyTool(parent=None, force=False):
    """Creates a tool under the given `parent` and registers it with the interface."""
    return QtWidgets.QDialog(parent=parent)

@uninstaller("MyToolNamespace", "MyToolName")
def uninstallMyTool(tool):
    """Removes a tool and deregisters it from the interface."""
    tool.deleteLater()

# Create a tool under a parent
parent = QtWidgets.QMainWindow()
tool = installMyTool(parent=parent, force=False)

# Returns the existing tool since `force=False`
tool = install(namespace="MyToolNamespace", name="MyToolName", parent=parent, force=False)

# Reinstalls the tool since `force=True`
tool = installMyTool(parent=parent, force=True)

# Uninstalls the tool
uninstallMyTool(tool)

Installation¶

A tool can be installed by directly invoking a decorated installer or by indirectly invoking the installer by passing the registered tool type to install(). Either invocation will result in the installed tool being tracked within the internal tool data registry. Any action which results in the removal of the tool will result in the removal of the internal tool data for that tool.

Considerations¶

Registered tools are retrieved dynamically from a static identifier (memory address of the c++ object). Refer to msTools.coreUI.qt.widget_utils.retain() for details relating to the safe handling of Qt objects.
msTools.tools.tool_manager.deregisterToolType(namespace=None, name=None)¶

Deregister a tool type.

Designed for use when developing a tool as it is necessary to deregister a tool before reloading a module.

Parameters:
  • namespace (basestring) – A registered tool type namespace.
  • name (basestring) – A registered tool type name.
msTools.tools.tool_manager.install(namespace, name, parent=None, force=False)¶

Install a tool to a given parent by indirectly invoking the registered installer which corresponds to the given tool type.

Parameters:
  • namespace (basestring) – A registered tool type namespace.
  • name (basestring) – A registered tool type name.
  • parent (T <= PySide2.QtCore.QObject, optional) – The parent object for the tool. Defaults to None - the tool has no parent.
  • force (bool) – Whether to reinstall the tool if one already exists under parent. If False, skip installation if a tool whose tool type corresponds to the given namespace and name already exists under parent. Defaults to False.
Raises:

RuntimeError – If the given namespace and name do not correspond to a registered tool type.
Returns:

T <= PySide2.QtCore.QObject – A tool parented under parent whose registered tool type corresponds to the given namespace and name. If force is False, this could be an existing tool.
msTools.tools.tool_manager.installer(namespace, name)¶

Decorator factory for producing a decorator which can be used to register a callable as a tool installer.

A tool installer must be implemented in accordance with the following guidelines:

  1. The return value must be the installed tool, whose type is a non-strict subclass of PySide2.QtCore.QObject.
  2. The first argument must be named parent and is responsible for receiving the tool’s parent. It can be an optional argument whose default value is None.
  3. The installer is allowed to implement an optional force argument which accepts a bool value. The argument determines whether a tool should be reinstalled if there is already an existing tool under parent. When an existing tool is found under parent, installation will be skipped if force is False and the existing tool will be returned. This argument defaults to False if the installer does not choose to reimplement it.
Parameters:
  • namespace (basestring) – The tool namespace used to register the decorated tool installer within the internal tool type registry.
  • name (basestring) – The tool name used to register the decorated tool installer within the internal tool type registry.
Raises:
  • RuntimeError – If the first argument is not named parent.
  • RuntimeError – If there is already an installer registered to the given namespace and name combination.
msTools.tools.tool_manager.isInstalled(namespace, name, parent=None)¶

Check if a tool corresponding to the given tool type is installed to a given parent.

Parameters:
  • namespace (basestring) – A registered tool type namespace.
  • name (basestring) – A registered tool type name.
  • parent (T <= PySide2.QtCore.QObject, optional) – The parent object to check for a registered tool. Defaults to None - the tool has no parent.
Returns:

bool – True if parent is the parent of a tool whose tool type corresponds to the given namespace and name, otherwise False.
msTools.tools.tool_manager.iterInstalled(namespace=None, name=None)¶

Iterate over tools corresponding to the given tool type.

Parameters:
  • namespace (basestring) – A registered tool type namespace.
  • name (basestring) – A registered tool type name.
Yields:

T <= PySide2.QtCore.QObject – A tool whose tool type corresponds to the given namespace and name.
msTools.tools.tool_manager.iterToolTypes(namespace=None)¶

Iterate over registered tool types.

Parameters:

namespace (basestring, optional) – A registered tool type namespace, used to filter the results to a specific namespace. Defaults to None - yield tool types for all registered tool type namespaces.
Yields:

(str, str) – A two tuple for each tool type:

  1. The namespace of a registered tool type.
  2. The name of a registered tool type under the namespace.
msTools.tools.tool_manager.uninstall(namespace, name, parent=None)¶

Uninstall a tool from a given parent by indirectly invoking the registered uninstaller which corresponds to the given tool type.

Parameters:
  • namespace (basestring) – A registered tool type namespace.
  • name (basestring) – A registered tool type name.
  • parent (T <= PySide2.QtCore.QObject, optional) – The parent object for the tool. Defaults to None - the tool has no parent.
Raises:

RuntimeError – If the given namespace and name do not correspond to a registered tool type.
Returns:

The result of the registered uninstaller.
msTools.tools.tool_manager.uninstallFromAll(namespace, name)¶

Uninstall all tools corresponding to the given tool type by indirectly invoking the registered uninstaller for each existing parent.

Parameters:
  • namespace (basestring) – A registered tool type namespace.
  • name (basestring) – A registered tool type name.
Raises:

RuntimeError – If the given namespace and name do not correspond to a registered tool type.
msTools.tools.tool_manager.uninstaller(namespace, name)¶

Decorator factory for producing a decorator which can be used to register a callable as a tool uninstaller.

A tool uninstaller must be implemented in accordance with the following guidelines:

  1. The first argument must be named tool and is responsible for receiving the tool to uninstall.
Parameters:
  • namespace (basestring) – The tool namespace used to register the decorated tool uninstaller within the internal tool type registry.
  • name (basestring) – The tool name used to register the decorated tool uninstaller within the internal tool type registry.
Raises:
  • RuntimeError – If the first argument is not named tool.
  • RuntimeError – If there is already an uninstaller registered to the given namespace and name combination.
